Package de.dosmike.sponge.megamenus.api.elements

The M??? classes in this package implementing IElement can be seen as example.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BackgroundProvider
    The background provider will be called for every slot in the menu that is not occupied by an IElement.
    IIcon
    A collection of ItemStackSnapshots the can be rendered as static or animated icon in GUI menus
    PositionProvider
    These providers help automatically determining the next SlotPos a element should be placed in a IMenu based on the previous slot a IElement was added to.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    IIcon.Builder
    A convenience builder for animated IIcons.
    Specify the item snapshots and frequency and the rest should automatically be handled.
    The animation will play at a constant rate.
    MButton
    This element acts like a button, it can be clicked at and performs an action.
    MButton.Builder  
    MCheckbox
    This element displays a tri-state that toggles when clicking on it.
    MCheckbox.Builder  
    MIcon
    This is a raw element that has no function other than drawing an icon with text.
    Other than MLabel this will render as ItemStack on hover in a Text UI.
    For GUI renders it behaves exactly like an MLabel
    MIcon.Builder  
    MLabel
    This is a raw element that has no function other than drawing an icon with text.
    This is a special element for Text UIs that won't render as ItemStack on hover.
    For GUI renders it behaves exactly like an MIcon
    MLabel.Builder  
    MSlot
    This is a menu element that behaves like a regular inventory slot.
    MSlot.Builder  
    MSpinner
    This element displays a cyclic value.
    MSpinner.Builder  

Package de.dosmike.sponge.megamenus.api.elements Description

The M??? classes in this package implementing IElement can be seen as example. Those classes are primarily marked final, because it's super easy to miss having to expand the copy() function with added information.
If you need to implement custom behaviours/elements, feel free to copy a M-Class source into one of your packages and modify it to your liking. Just don't forget to properly implement all methods.
